ARABIC: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱلْءَاخِرَةِ زَيَّنَّا لَهُمْ أَعْمَٰلَهُمْ فَهُمْ يَعْمَهُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: As for those who do not have iman in the Next World. We have made their actions appear good to them and they wander about blindly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: We make their deeds attractive to those who do not believe in the Hereafter, so that they may wander in perplexity.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: As for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have made their deeds seem attractive to them so they stumble around in perplexity.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We have made the deeds of those who do not believe in the life to come, attractive to them and they wander about blindly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Those who do not believe in the Hereafter – We have made their deeds seem good to them, so they are astray.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, those who believe not in the Hereafter, We have made their deeds fair seeming to them, so that they wander about blindly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: As to those who do not believe in the hereafter, We have surely made their deeds fair-seeming to them, but they blindly wander on.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Those who believe not in the Hereafter, We have decked out fair for them their works, and they wander blindly;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! as for those who believe not in the Hereafter, We have made their works fairseeming unto them so that they are all astray.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: We have made those who do not believe in the Hereafter feel their actions appear good to them, so they wander blindly:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily those who believe not in the Hereafter - fairseeming unto them We have made their works, so that they wander perplexed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: As for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have made their deeds seem decorous to them, and so they are bewildered.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: As to those who believe not in the Hereafter, We have made their deeds pleasing in their eyes; and so they wander about in distraction.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily, those who believe not in the Hereafter, We have made their deeds fair-seeming to them, so they wander about blindly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: As for those who do not believe in the Everlasting Life, We have decorated for them their works, and they wander blindly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: As for those who do not believe in the Hereafter: We made their deeds appear good to them, so they wander aimlessly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have made pleasing to them their deeds, so they wander blindly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [27:4]   Truly those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have adorned their, vile, deeds for them, by making such [deeds] seem sensuous so that they then deem them wholesome, and so they are bewildered, confused about why We deem these [deeds] to be vile.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! as for those who believe not in the Hereafter) those who do not believe in resurrection after death: Abu Jahl and his host, (We have made their works fair-seeming unto them) in their state of disbelief (so that they are all astray) so they proceed blindly, unable to see.
